Column Comment.0: R JURISDICTION: name of province state or county responsible for activities, suchasAlberta crown, BC, Sask, BLM, federal
Column Comment.1: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale.
Column Comment.2: LAND SALE OFFERING ID: Unique identifier for the land sale offering.
Column Comment.3: LAND OFFERING BID: Unique identifier for a bid. Within the bid, individualcomponents may be sequenced using PRIORITY ORDER. This enables grouped,contingent, sliding and other types of grouped bids to be tracked.
Column Comment.4: WORK BID IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work bid component
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CRITICAL DATE: the date that the bid component is to be completed.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, theoriginal valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.9: DESCRIPTION: description of the work bid.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: General remarks about the work bid component.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: WORK BID COUNT: the number that is proposed in the work bid, such as thenumber of wells to be drilled, km of seismic to be shot etc.
Column Comment.16: WORK BID UNIT OF MEASURE: the unit of measure that qualifies the count. WhereWORK BID TYPE is" record seismic data", WORK BID COUNT is 5, UOM may bekilometers.
Column Comment.17: WORK BID TYPE: The type of bid component that is part of a work bid. Examplesmay include drilling, shooting seismic etc.
Column Comment.18: WORK BID VALUE: the relative cost value of the work bid, or the amount that will bespent on the work bid component.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
